channel.title: Suggestions
channel.description: Have a suggestion for one of our add-ons? Tell us about it here!

item.title: Holiday Joy Upgrade
item.author: invalid@example.com (Maxxamillion)
item.dc:creator: Maxxamillion
item.content:encoded:
So i was thinking that the small holiday joy addon could do with a small upgrade, one that includes different events for the year.

it should include
-Christmas (which is already does)
-Halloween
-Easter
-Thanks Giving
-Birthday
-New year

I think that having cool images like the holiday joy one around the year would be a nice addition to any forum.

item.title: Roster needs features
item.author: invalid@example.com (Commodore)
item.dc:creator: Commodore
item.content:encoded:
I purchased this today on Thanksgiving, but I'm not sure I can use this in it's current state.

I didn't realize how bare bones it is.

Top reasons I can't use this now:

1. Have to manually build each field AND manually add users. I'm basically duplicating the Member list by hand. Solution: There needs to be a syncing feature with the member list and/or a way to automatically add users when they are added to a user group.

2. Users need a way to enter info.

item.title: Suggested Addon: Discord Integration.
item.author: invalid@example.com (Ev1dentFir3)
item.dc:creator: Ev1dentFir3
item.content:encoded:
Working the same as Teamspeak Intigration, Discord Intigration would have all the same features, just use a much different API.

Discord is putting the nuce around Teamspeaks neck because they are completely free, have much more complete android, iphone, and even blackberry apps. Use IRC chat for seperatly integrating, into other software, like twitch and minecraft servers. And have a much easier to use permission system. All this for FREE.

I have already paid for the TS Integration but...

Suggested Addon: Discord Integration.

item.title: Guest Tickets & Registration
item.author: invalid@example.com (Alfa1)
item.dc:creator: Alfa1
item.content:encoded: A lot of the tickets we get are by guests who have trouble with the registration process. It is already possible to allow guests to open tickets. But when they register there will be an account with the same email. The software should connect the ticket to the registered account.

item.title: Open Tickets on member card
item.author: invalid@example.com (Alfa1)
item.dc:creator: Alfa1
item.content:encoded:
Please display the number of open tickets on member card. (staff viewing only)
Please position it next to warning points.
The reason to only display the number of open tickets is that this will give staff a quick way to see if there are open issues with the member.

item.title: Why is there no Tickets profile tab?
item.author: invalid@example.com (Alfa1)
item.dc:creator: Alfa1
item.content:encoded:
Is this a bug or has this not yet been developed?
All major addons have a profile tab to display the users content.
It is essential for both staff as members to be able to check a users tickets on profile.

item.title: Channel Admin Sync
item.author: invalid@example.com (erich199)

item.content:encoded:
I would like to see a Channel Admin sync like burning board has

https://pluginstore.woltlab.com/file/1820-teamspeak-3-synchronization-channel-groups/

item.title: Check for similar AMS or Vaultwiki articles
item.author: invalid@example.com (Alfa1)
item.dc:creator: Alfa1
item.content:encoded:
One thing that would be extremely useful is a check for similar AMS or Vaultwiki articles because that will really cut down on the number of tickets.
The idea is that the user first posts his question. Then if there is no answer in the articles, they can go on to post a ticket. If there are articles for frequently asked questions then this method cuts down on 80% of the tickets.
See here for how kayako does it: https://support.kayako.com/Tickets/Submit/RenderForm
As soon as you...

Check for similar AMS or Vaultwiki articles

item.title: Toggle Privacy Information
item.author: invalid@example.com (Soulzz)
item.dc:creator: Soulzz
item.content:encoded: A few users have complained to me that they don't want their email to be visible in the ticket display information. Can an option be created to turn this feature off?

Please add a 'staff discussion' tab to tickets which hold a thread that staff can use to discuss. These staff discussion threads could reside in a forum node only visible to staff.

This suggestion is related to this:
https://pixelexit.com/threads/staff-comments.2851/

item.title: Variables in Predefined Ticket Responses
item.author: invalid@example.com (Alfa1)
item.dc:creator: Alfa1
item.content:encoded:
A predefined response always needs to be edited by the staff member to fill in the final details.
The username and the staff member name for example. It would save time if these would be filled in automatically by using variables.

For example:
Dear $username,

Your email address $useremail has not been verified yet. Please activate your account by verifying your email address. Instructions and helpful information can be found here: http://somelink.com
Please read the whole page....

Variables in Predefined Ticket Responses

item.title: Make ticket status more prominent in ticket sidebar

item.content:encoded:
A small tweak:
The status of a ticket should be really easy to see. But its in a list of other information.
Please make the status more prominent. For example by putting the text in a banner. (Like user titles)
